main event: A civilian witness observed a reddish, round, unidentified flying object flashing and moving back and forth unevenly in a north to south direction for about 28 minutes near San Angelo, Texas on September 23, 1966.
interesting points: The object appeared to be approximately two miles away and two miles in elevation from the observer.
The object faded out twice and returned, and the observer stated it was definitely not a star.
There were no known aircraft or weather balloons in the area at the time of the sighting.
The witness had seen a similar object about 6 months earlier but did not report it.
The witness seemed reliable and the night was reported to be cloudless with calm winds.
sighted object: a reddish, round, unidentified flying object
